title: OpenAI Releases GPT-5 with Native Reasoning Mode
excerpt: OpenAI has launched GPT-5, featuring a built-in chain-of-thought reasoning mode that can be toggled via API. Early benchmarks show a 40% improvement in math and coding tasks compared to GPT-4o.

title: Bun 2.0: Now with Full Windows Support and Compiled Binaries
excerpt: The fast JavaScript runtime Bun has reached version 2.0. This release brings stable performance on Windows and a new capability to compile TypeScript scripts into standalone executables.

title: GitHub Actions adds Managed GPU Runners for ML Workflows
excerpt: GitHub is making it easier to run large language models and other ML tasks by introducing managed GPU runners for Actions, eliminating the need for self-hosted infrastructure.

title: Critical RCE Found in Popular npm Package 'request-utils'
excerpt: A high-severity remote code execution vulnerability has been discovered in a utility package with over 2M weekly downloads. Users are urged to patch to v4.2.1 immediately.

title: Figma Variables: Advanced Logic and Theming Guide
excerpt: Deep dive into using Figma's newest variable types for complex UI state management, multi-mode theming, and automated design handoff workflows.

title: Cloudflare Workers Now Supports Python (Beta)
excerpt: Cloudflare has announced first-class support for Python in Workers, compiled to WebAssembly using the Pyodide runtime, enabling data science at the edge.

title: Pydantic v2.10: New Validation Engine and Performance Boost
excerpt: Pydantic has released v2.10, featuring a completely rewritten validation engine in Rust. This version offers up to 2x speedup for complex nested models and improved error reporting.

snippets.code:
from pydantic import BaseModel

class User(BaseModel):
    id: int
    name: str = "John Doe"

title: Tailwind CSS v4.0 Alpha: Faster Engine and New Oxide Compiler
excerpt: The Tailwind team has unveiled the alpha version of v4.0. It's powered by 'Oxide', a new high-performance compiler written in Rust that is 10x faster than the current JIT engine.

title: Fallas Valencia 2026 Survival Guide: 15 Tips You Actually Need
excerpt: Las Fallas is five days of controlled chaos across an entire city — 750+ burning monuments, daily gunpowder explosions, 2M visitors. This guide covers the practical things that will make or break your experience.

snippets.code:
WHAT TO PACK:

1. Earplugs — La Mascleta is painfully loud
2. Comfortable walking shoes — 12-18 km/day
3. Portable battery pack — your phone will die
4. Light layers — 12-20°C in March
5. Small daypack — water, battery, snacks

KEY DATES:
15-19 March: Main festival
18 March: La Ofrenda (flower procession)
19 March: La Crema (all monuments burn)

QUÉ LLEVAR:

1. Tapones para los oídos — La Mascleta duele
2. Calzado cómodo — 12-18 km al día
3. Batería portátil — tu móvil va a morir
4. Capas ligeras — 12-20°C en marzo
5. Mochila pequeña — agua, batería, comida

FECHAS CLAVE:
15-19 marzo: Festival principal
18 marzo: La Ofrenda (procesión de flores)
19 marzo: La Crema (se queman todos los monumentos)

title: Best Apps for Las Fallas 2026: Which One Should You Download?
excerpt: Over 750 fallas monuments, a city-wide festival, and millions of visitors. You need the right app. This guide compares your realistic options and explains which Fallas map app is worth installing.

snippets.code:
MIS FALLAS APP — WHAT IT COVERS:

✓ 750+ monuments on interactive Mapbox map
✓ 8 category filters (Especial, Infantil, etc.)
✓ Full event calendar grouped by date
✓ Walking directions to any monument
✓ Works offline (cached map tiles)
✓ No login required
✓ EN / ES / Valencian
✓ Free on iOS

APP MIS FALLAS — QUÉ INCLUYE:

✓ 750+ monumentos en mapa Mapbox interactivo
✓ 8 filtros de categoría (Especial, Infantil...)
✓ Calendario completo de eventos por fecha
✓ Rutas a pie hasta cualquier monumento
✓ Funciona sin cobertura (tiles cacheados)
✓ Sin registro necesario
✓ ES / EN / Valenciano
✓ Gratis en iOS
